[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: new()] [Session ID Collision] Can an attacker craft transaction metadata that causes SessionId::prologue_meta() to produce colliding session IDs across different transactions, potentially allowing cross-transaction state pollution or cache poisoning? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: new()] [Empty ChangeSet Bypass] Does initializing with VMChangeSet::empty() create a vulnerability where prologue execution bypasses validation of previous state changes, allowing malicious transactions to build on inconsistent state? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: new()] [Transaction Context Injection] Can an attacker manipulate txn_meta.as_user_transaction_context() to inject malicious context data (e.g., fake sender, manipulated gas limits, forged secondary signers) that bypasses prologue validation checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: new()] [Resolver State Race] If the resolver reference is modified concurrently during RespawnedSession::spawn(), can this cause the prologue session to operate on stale or inconsistent state data leading to incorrect transaction validation? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: new()] [VM Lifetime Manipulation] Can an attacker exploit the lifetime relationship between vm and the returned session to cause use-after-free or dangling reference issues when the session outlives the VM instance? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: into_user_session()] [Version Boundary Attack] At the exact boundary where gas_feature_version transitions from 0 to 1, can an attacker exploit race conditions to execute the same transaction through both legacy and new code paths, causing double state mutations? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: into_user_session()] [Cache Flush Bypass] In the gas_feature_version >= 1 path, if finish_with_squashed_change_set() fails but resource group cache was already released at line 76, does this leave the resolver in an inconsistent cached state for subsequent transactions? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: into_user_session()] [Module Storage Inconsistency] Can an attacker exploit the time window between finish_with_squashed_change_set() (line 68) and release_resource_group_cache() (line 76) to publish malicious modules that aren't properly reflected in the resource group cache? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/prologue.rs] [Function: into_user_session()] [SystemSessionChangeSet Validation Bypass] Does SystemSessionChangeSet::new() at line 73 properly validate all constraints, or can malicious prologue changes exceed write limits, event limits, or other storage constraints to cause state bloat?
